description:
When an instance fails to get an IP address (due to out of IPs, etc), the vif is left around with a network_id of None.  This causes exceptions when trying to delete the instance in the following methods:

build_network_info_model() and get_instance_nw_info() in the network manager.

Both have the following code:

for vif in vifs:
    network = self._get_network_by_id(context, vif['network_id'])
 
That'll end up raising because we try to get a network of id 'None' out of the DB, and there is no such network.

So far, I patched both to do:
    if not vif['network_id']:
        continue

before the _get_network_by_id() call.

This also required a fix in fake_network where it was setting up fakes with ids of 0.  That fix is here:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/4460/

I'm not positive the 'continue' code I added is appropriate... but I know the above paste is a fix we'll need to make.
title: instance's won't delete when vif has no network
